Understate: The claim may understate the impact of the coronavirus pandemic and recent events on the inauguration ceremony, as well as the measures taken to ensure safety.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that flags were added to the National Mall to make the inauguration look less empty.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the addition of flags was solely intended to make the inauguration look less empty, without considering other possible reasons or symbolic meanings behind the exhibition.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the addition of flags, such as honoring the Americans who could not attend due to COVID-19 or representing unity and patriotism.
